programme.title: Life During Wartime
programme.desc: One sister is a bitter screenwriter, another meets an older man she hopes will give structure to her disordered life, and a third must deal with a child-molesting ex-husband who has been paroled from jail and wants to reconcile with their son. Allison Janney, Ally Sheedy and Shirley Henderson star in this dysfunctional family drama from director Todd Solondz, a sequel to his earlier film "Happiness" that casts new actors in the same roles.(n)

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
programme.desc: Coroner Tommy Tilden and son Austin run a morgue and crematorium in Virginia. When the local sheriff brings in a body found in the basement of a home, it seems like just another open-and-shut case. As the autopsy proceeds however, they are left reeling as the inspection brings new revelations. Perfectly preserved on the outside, Jane Doe seems to have been the victim of a horrific ritualistic torture. Tommy and Austin begin to piece together these gruesome discoveries, as an unnatural force takes hold of the crematorium.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Persuasion
programme.desc: When high school student Kimberly Joyce accuses her English teacher of sexual harassment, she turns her exclusive Beverly Hills private school, and everything else in her wake, upside down. Hell hath no fury like a teenager scorned.(n)

programme.title: Margin Call
programme.desc: Set in the high-stakes world of the ﬁnancial industry, this film follows the key players at an investment ﬁrm during a 24-hour period in the early stages of the 2008 ﬁnancial crisis. When an entry-level analyst unlocks information that could prove to be the downfall of the ﬁrm, a roller-coaster ride ensues as decisions both ﬁnancial and moral catapult the lives of all involved into mayhem.(n)

programme.title: Dudes & Dragons
programme.desc: When a powerful wizard is jilted by a princess, he vows to rid the land of love and commands a fire breathing dragon to destroy any sign of affection seen throughout the kingdom but as the death toll rises, a brave and arrogant warrior and his estranged brother answer the princess’ call to fight the curse.(n)

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.(n)

programme.title: Mrs McCutcheon
programme.desc: Having always felt he was born in the wrong body, 10-year-old Tom chooses the name Mrs McCutcheon rather than the name he was given at birth; he also prefers the flow of a dress rather than the cut of a pant. Now at his third school, Tom is having trouble settling in and finding acceptance from his newfound peers - except for Trevor, a tough little charmer who also suffers prejudice due to his Aboriginal heritage.(n)

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
programme.desc: Romantic comedy-drama about a pair of American friends (Scarlett Johansson and Rebecca Hall) who vacation together in Spain and fall under the romantic spell of Juan, a passionate artist (Javier Bardem).(n)

programme.title: The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: This eye-opening documentary tells the story of the Barnes Collection, $25 billion worth of masterpieces by Cezanne, Matisse and Renoir that has become the focus of a culture war between those who wish to preserve the intentions of the collection's original owner, and a conspiracy of politically powerful corporations seeking to profit by seizing and relocating the artwork.(n)

programme.title: Body
programme.desc: After three twenty-something girls break into a mansion and inadvertently murder the groundskeeper, they slowly self-destruct as they decide what to do with the dead body in the living room.(n)

programme.title: Bad Girl
programme.desc: Amy must fight to save her adoptive parents from their self-styled vengeful blood daughter, Chloe.(n)

programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.(n)

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
programme.desc: Romantic comedy-drama about a pair of American friends (Scarlett Johansson and Rebecca Hall) who vacation together in Spain and fall under the romantic spell of Juan, a passionate artist (Javier Bardem).(n)

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: Welcome to Greenleaf, a picture-perfect Indiana town where the high school is the proud focus of attention. On the night of the Oscars telecast, the town's center of attention is Greenleaf teacher Howard Brackett when a former student, who's now a winning actor, tells the audience of millions that Howard is gay. Kevin Kline plays stunned Howard, who scrambles to go forth with his wedding to devoted Emily (Joan Cusack) and assert his manliness.(n)

programme.title: This Isn't Funny
programme.desc: Eliot is a stand up comedian with crippling anxiety, while Jamie avoids life through partying and travel. When Jamie rides his bike into Eliot's car their exchange is not exactly pleasant. Eliot then riffs on their encounter in her set that night and Jamie is there to see it. Suddenly the chemistry is undeniable. Just as they open themselves up and see they might be a fit, new job opportunities and family crises strain their relationship.(n)

programme.title: SXSW Comedy with Natasha Leggero Part 2
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Natasha Leggero hosts an all-star lineup of the most hilarious minds in comedy, including Emo Phillips, Sean Patton, Ian Edwards, Kurt Braunohler and Eliza Skinner.(n)

programme.title: I, Daniel Blake
programme.desc: Daniel Blake (Dave Johns) is a man out of time. He's a widowed woodworker who's never owned a computer and lives according to his own common sense moral code. After a heart attack leaves him unable to work and the state welfare system fails him, Daniel must stand up and fight for his dignity and lead a one-man crusade for compassion that transforms the lives of a single mother (Hayley Squires) and her two children.(n)

programme.title: Beyond the Opposite Sex
programme.desc: This documentary picks up the respective stories of Rene and Jamie, 13 years after their Gender Affirmation Surgeries. The two subjects let us back into their very changed worlds and find that their surgeries, which had been lifelong goals, were far from the finish line of their journeys - in fact, they turned out to be only the beginning of more difficult, arduous and true lifelong experiences.(n)

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: Welcome to Greenleaf, a picture-perfect Indiana town where the high school is the proud focus of attention. On the night of the Oscars telecast, the town's center of attention is Greenleaf teacher Howard Brackett when a former student, who's now a winning actor, tells the audience of millions that Howard is gay. Kevin Kline plays stunned Howard, who scrambles to go forth with his wedding to devoted Emily (Joan Cusack) and assert his manliness.(n)

programme.title: Burke & Hare
programme.desc: A pair of financially strapped, 19th century Irishmen (Simon Pegg and Andy Serkis) discover a lucrative if gruesome source of income when they begin providing corpses for medical experiments to a well-regarded Edinburgh doctor. Their newly filled coffers and the expensive attentions of their romantic interests, however, soon pressure them to continue and even enhance the cadaver procurement process. Isla Fisher costars in this dark period comedy.(n)

programme.title: Crowning Jules
programme.desc: Jules is a bright and sassy 17 year-old who desperately wants to leave her Midwestern family's alumni traditions behind, but to get to her once-in-a-lifetime Harvard admissions interview, she's forced to hitch a ride with her twin sister/nemesis, Madison, who is headed to a beauty pageant. Their road trip takes a turn when the teenage sisters unwittingly come into possession of a stolen jewel and are pursued by dangerous thieves.(n)

programme.title: Alone in Berlin
programme.desc: Otto and Anna Quangel (Brendan Gleeson & Emma Thompson) are a working-class husband and wife doing their best to ride out the war in Berlin in 1940. When their son is killed fighting on the frontlines however, everything changes. They begin pouring their rage and grief into postcards emblazoned with anti-Nazi slogans, risking everything to get their messages of protest across the city. This seemingly small act of subversion rattles the regime, including a police inspector (Daniel Brühl) who will not rest until the culprits have been caught.(n)

programme.title: Against the Current
programme.desc: Justin Kirk and Joseph Fiennes star in this independent drama about a middle-aged man who decides to fulfill a childhood dream of swimming 150 miles of the Hudson River with his best friend rowing alongside for encouragement, but a bittersweet hidden agenda for the feat is gradually revealed. Mary Tyler Moore costars.(n)

programme.title: Momma
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy living in a trailer park carries on with his schoolwork and daily chores petrified at the thought of being taken away from his mother.(n)

programme.title: Winter Passing
programme.desc: In this dramatic comedy, Zooey Deschanel stars as a struggling twenty-something actress who goes in search of her legendary, reclusive novelist father and must wrestle with his unconventional new family and their shared past. Also stars Ed Harris and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Comet
programme.desc: Justin Long and Emmy Rossum are star-crossed lovers in an alternate universe, whose relationship blooms and unravels over the course of six years. A chance encounter brings them together, and the story zigzags back and forth in time—from a meteor shower in LA, to an encounter in a Paris hotel room, to a fateful phone call— resulting in a portrait of the relationship between the cynical Dell (Long) and the quick-witted Kimberly (Rossum).(n)

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.(n)

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.(n)

programme.title: Paths of Glory
programme.desc: Stanley Kubrick directed this gripping antiwar tract about a battlefield officer-lawyer defending three French soldiers unjustly accused of cowardice during World War I. Based on actual events.

programme.title: The Man from Snowy River
programme.desc: After a terrible accident, the son of a livestock farmer is orphaned and forced off his land by mountain men who claim he must earn the right to his inheritance. He gets a job at a nearby ranch, but is forbidden from participating in a cattle roundup once he gets there. While waiting at the farm, he meets his boss's daughter and the two fall in love. After her father finds out, they must navigate his disapproval and reclaim the stolen farm.

programme.title: Scene of the Crime
programme.desc: A tough Los Angeles detective investigates the murder of his ex-partner, a plainclothes policeman who may have been a dirty cop and involved in a gambling operation.

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
programme.desc: Four men hijack a Manhattan subway train and hold it for a ransom of $1 million.

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Three criminals attempt to steal an army shipment of gold bars from a moving locomotive in 19th-century England.

programme.title: The Blue Angel
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich plays a tawdry cabaret singer (introducing the song "Falling in Love Again") who becomes the object of obsession for a highly moral, elderly professor.

programme.title: Kitty Foyle
programme.desc: A working-class woman marries a wealthy man for his money, rather than the poor doctor she genuinely loves, and quickly clashes with her husband's family. Eventually she breaks away from him, only to find out she's carrying his child. Ginger Rogers won a Best Actress Oscar as the titular character.

programme.title: Scene of the Crime
programme.desc: A tough Los Angeles detective investigates the murder of his ex-partner, a plainclothes policeman who may have been a dirty cop and involved in a gambling operation.

programme.title: Easy Living
programme.desc: A pro-football player learns that he suffers from a potentially deadly heart condition, and must decide whether to play on rather or retire to a coaching position due to the demands of his pampered wife.

programme.title: An American in Paris
programme.desc: A former GI who remained in the City of Light to study painting is discovered by a wealthy benefactor, but he betrays her by romancing a woman who, unbeknownst to him, is already in a relationship with his best friend. A Best Picture winner. Gene Kelly stars and served as the film's choreographer. (cc).

programme.title: Friendly Persuasion
programme.desc: William Wyler's beautifully made film about a Quaker family in Civil War Indiana, where the father struggles to adhere to his pacifist ways, while his teenage son undergoes a crisis of conscience over whether to sign up for military service or not and be judged a coward. Oscar nominated for Best Picture, Adapted Screenplay, Director, Sound, Supporting Actor (Anthony Perkins) and Song ("Thee I Love"). Remade in 1975. (cc).

programme.title: Period of Adjustment
programme.desc: An exploration of the problems facing newlyweds who tied the knot on a whim, and an older married couple, the husband of whom got hitched because he stood to inherit his father-in-law's business. An adaptation of a Tennessee Williams play.

programme.title: Phone Call From a Stranger
programme.desc: The sole survivor of a crash contacts the victims' next of kin. Gary Merrill, Shelley Winters, Michael Rennie, Bette Davis, Keenan Wynn, Craig Stevens, Evelyn Varden, Helen Westcott. Marty: Warren Stevens. Mrs. Fortness: Beatrice Straight. Jean Negulesco directed.(n)

programme.title: Three Coins in the Fountain
programme.desc: Oscars went to Milton Krasner's location photography and to the title song of this romance about three young American women looking for love in Italy. A Best Picture nominee.(n)

programme.title: Way Down East
programme.desc: D.W. Griffith directed this silent classic about the betrayal of an innocent country girl.(n)

programme.title: The Idiot
programme.desc: Akira Kurosawa's adaptation of Dostoyevsky's classic novel "The Idiot," about an ex-soldier (Masayuki Mori), considered dim-witted because of seizures related to his wartime experiences; his friend; and the woman both of them fall for.(n)

programme.title: Mademoiselle Fifi
programme.desc: A spunky laundress (Simone Simon) saves the French honor during the Prussian invasion of the 1870s.(n)

programme.title: The Seventh Victim
programme.desc: A young woman arrives in New York's Greenwich Village in search of her missing sister. Gradually, she is drawn into a strange netherworld of Satan worshippers who may be responsible for her sister's disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Ship
programme.desc: When a ship captain shows signs of mental breakdown, a young sailor under his command tries to warn the rest of the crew before all their lives are endangered.(n)

programme.title: Bedlam
programme.desc: In 1760s London, an actress, appalled at the horrific conditions in a hospital for the insane, campaigns to reform the institution, but instead finds herself committed by the corrupt head of the asylum.(n)

programme.title: Isle of the Dead
programme.desc: Terror reigns on the citizens of a Greek island besieged by a plague in 1912 during the Balkan Wars.(n)

programme.title: The Leopard Man
programme.desc: After a leopard used in a nightclub act escapes, mysterious murders begin occurring in a quiet New Mexico town.(n)

programme.title: Please Believe Me
programme.desc: An English girl inherits a ranch and is pursued by a playboy, a fortune hunter and a lawyer.(n)

programme.title: Youth Runs Wild
programme.desc: Story of youngsters on the loose while their parents work in war factories. Bonita Granville. Frank: Glenn Vernon. Danny: Kent Smith. Mary: Jean Brooks. Taylor: Ben Bard. Sarah: Tessa Brind (Vanessa Brown). Duncan: Lawrence Tierney. Georgie: Dickie Moore. Mark Robson directed.(n)

programme.title: Cat People
programme.desc: A mysterious woman becomes obsessed with the idea that she is a catwoman and turns feline when jealous.(n)

programme.title: Martin Scorsese Presents Val Lewton The Man in the Shadows
programme.desc: A profile of filmmaker Val Lewton (1904-51), who was famous in the 1940s for making affecting, quality horror pictures on a low budget, includes interviews with directors Roger Corman and Kiyoshi Kurosawa, and features clips from "Cat People," "I Walked With a Zombie" and "The Leopard Man." (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Them!
programme.desc: Atomic-bomb testing spawns an army of giant mutant ants that march through the storm drains of Los Angeles.(n)

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: A supply-train leader holds his own against his malevolent competition and contends with Comanche attacks, all the while searching for his father's killer.(n)

programme.title: Duchess of Idaho
programme.desc: A carnival swimmer helps her best friend get with the friend's boss, and tries to land a bandleader for herself.(n)

Baron: Reginald Owen. Countess: Hedda Hopper. Interesting cast, good direction. Directed by Monta Bell.(n)

programme.title: Loose Ankles
programme.desc: Romantic farce about a young heiress (Loretta Young) pursuing a boy (Douglas Fairbanks Jr.) her family finds acceptable. Katherine: Ethel Wales. Sarah: Louise Fazenda. Directed by Ted Wilde.(n)

programme.title: She Had to Say Yes
programme.desc: A secretary in a garment factory is torn between her salesman-fiancée and a rakish businessman who is one of his biggest customers.(n)

programme.title: Faithless
programme.desc: Soap opera about once-socially prominent lovers during the Depression. She's an heiress who loses her fortune, but marries a millionaire for money, and he's an executive who winds up working as a blue-collar laborer.(n)

programme.desc: Exposé of brutal prison conditions in the South. Richard Dix, Tom Brown, Rochelle Hudson, Louise Carter. Skinner: C. Henry Gordon. Whiteside: Stanley Fields. Billings: Oscar Apfel. programme.title: Safe in Hell
programme.desc: Well-acted yarn about a murderer (Dorothy Mackaill) hiding out with her lover (Donald Cook) in a tropical refuge. Van Saal: Ralf Harolde. Egan: John Wray. Bruno: Morgan Wallace. programme.title: Blonde Crazy
programme.desc: James Cagney and Joan Blondell are a wisecracking team in this cleverly written yarn about two hotel employees who form a confidence team. Barker: Louis Calhern. Helen: Noel Francis. programme.title: Star Wars The Force Awakens
programme.desc: In this continuation of the epic space opera, an ex-stormtrooper, a scrappy desert dweller and a droid companion embark on a journey that brings them face-to-face with heroes from the past, who are now battling a fascist regime called the First Order. (cc).

programme.title: I Am Legend

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary

programme.title: Robin Williams Come Inside My Mind

programme.title: Outcast

programme.title: The Broken

programme.desc: After a priceless Rembrandt painting is stolen from a New York skyscraper in a daring and technically sophisticated robbery, an ambitious insurance agent tries to catch a brilliant thief by persuading him to join her in a heist. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: In the eighth installment of the "Fast and the Furious" series, Dominic Toretto's crew are rocked to their core when they must face their most-dangerous adversary yet: Dom himself, who is now working with a shadowy cyber-terrorist known only as Cipher. As DSS agent Luke Hobbs and the rest of the team attempt to fight back, they find themselves in an alliance with their old enemy, assassin Deckard Shaw. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Outcast
programme.desc: The possessions continue as Kyle struggles to protect those close to him. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Cooties
programme.desc: An outbreak of cooties turns the students at an elementary school into flesh-eating zombies, trapping the faculty inside the building and forcing them to fight for their survival. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Wrong Turn
programme.desc: Crazed, cannibalistic hillbillies terrorize a group of twentysomething motorists stranded in the woods of West Virginia. Gory and contrived. Desmond Harrington, Eliza Dushku. Rob Schmidt directed. (cc).(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Two street racers go undercover to take down a drug magnate in this sequel to 2001's "The Fast and the Furious." (cc).(n)

programme.title: Once upon a Time in Mexico
programme.desc: A corrupt CIA agent teams up with a guitar-playing gunslinger to stop a coup South of the Border. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Extreme Ops
programme.desc: Extreme-sports enthusiasts run afoul of a slippery terrorist and his henchmen while filming a commercial in the Austrian Alps. Slick action, absurd plot. Devon Sawa, Rufus Sewell, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Medallion
programme.desc: A Hong Kong cop (Jackie Chan) is transformed into a superhuman warrior by an all-powerful amulet. Chan's charm and physical antics compensate for the so-so plot. Chan also co-executive produced. Gordon Chan directed. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Happy Death Day
programme.desc: A college student is trapped in a time loop that forces her to keep reliving a birthday that ends with her murder at the hands of a masked madman. As she repeats the same day, she tries to figure out her killer's identity so she can avoid a grisly fate. (cc).(n)

programme.title: My Little Eye
programme.desc: In this British thriller, five contestants on a reality show spend six months together in an isolated house. They begin to turn on each other after the arrival of a stranger and a gun loaded with five bullets. (cc).(n)

programme.title: From Within
programme.desc: A young Christian named Lindsay (Elizabeth Rice) finds her faith shaken when her small town is beset by a rash of gruesome suicides. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Broken
programme.desc: A woman is thrust into a world where everything is subtly unfamiliar in this thriller starring Lena Headey. Gina McVey is enjoying dinner with her family and her boyfriend Stefan when a mirror shatters without cause. The next day Gina sees a woman who looks like her own doppelganger. Curious, Gina sneaks into the woman's apartment and sees a photo of herself and her father. Later, Gina notices that Stefan is not the same and begins having horrific nightmares. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A team of mercenaries wage war on the CIA after they're double-crossed by rogue agent Max (Jason Patric) during a mission in the Bolivian jungle. But in order to get to Max, the team will need a little help from sexy operative Aisha (Zoe Saldana), who has her own reasons for joining the fight. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Weekend at Bernie's
programme.desc: A boss invites two underlings to his beach house with the intention of having them killed because they uncovered his illegal activities. However, when they arrive and discover the boss himself is dead, the pair spends the weekend pretending he's alive so that they can enjoy the place and figure out how to get themselves out of harm's way. (cc).

programme.title: Why Him?
programme.desc: An adoring dad is horrified to discover that his daughter's tech-billionaire boyfriend is a tattooed, party-hearty lout. Despite the latter's heart of gold, the father refuses to warm to him—especially when he learns about his engagement plans. (cc).

programme.title: View from the Top
programme.desc: A woman from a trailer park (Gwyneth Paltrow) aspires to become a flight attendant at a prestigious airline. Paltrow has first-class charm, but the gags fall flat. Christina Applegate, Mike Myers, Candice Bergen. Bruno Barreto directed. Rob Lowe and George Kennedy have cameos. (cc).

programme.title: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore enchants as a Chicago newspaper editor who relives her hellish teen years while on an undercover assignment at a local high school. Barrymore's great, but the film celebrates the fact that her character wins over the same type of “in crowd” that taunted her as a teen. David Arquette costars as her cool brother. Raja Gosnell is the director, and Barrymore served as executive producer. (cc).

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: Thrilling adventure yarn about eight sled dogs struggling to survive when bad weather leaves them marooned at an Antarctic research post. The fact-based film is similar to the 1983 Japanese film "Nankyoku Monogatari," which was released in the U.S. as "Antarctica." (cc).

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Five high-school students from different cliques spend a day-long detention together, and discover that they have more in common then they ever expected. (cc).

programme.title: Tin Cup
programme.desc: Comedy about a talented but aimless golf instructor (Kevin Costner) who enters the U.S. Open in a drive to win the heart of a student (Rene Russo). Romeo: Cheech Marin. Simms: Don Johnson. Co-written and directed by Ron Shelton. (cc).

programme.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
programme.desc: Dramatic fantasy about a librarian whose genetic disorder causes him to hurtle through time when under extreme duress. Despite this condition, he tries to build a relationship with a young heiress. Based on the best-selling novel by author Audrey Niffenegger. (cc).

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: While traveling to California with her boyfriend, a pregnant teen is abandoned at an Oklahoma Wal-Mart. She decides to stay, and makes a temporary home in the store while pondering her future. (cc).

programme.title: Love Potion No. 9
programme.desc: Two nerdy scientists become irresistible after drinking a palm reader's secret formula. (cc).

programme.title: Bananas
programme.desc: A neurotic New Yorker follows the woman he loves unrequitedly to a Central American country and becomes embroiled in a revolution, eventually becoming leader of the country. (cc).

programme.title: Taps
programme.desc: Military academy cadets take up arms against developers who are plotting to demolish their school. Though a General tries to quell the rebellion, he too is inspired to stand for the school when the Army is called in to rout the boys. (cc).

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Three women, separated by 80 years, struggle with similar crises linked by the novel Mrs. Dalloway. Author Virginia Woolf attempts to start writing that novel, a '50s housewife contemplates leaving her life behind and a modern-day book editor cares for a former boyfriend who's fighting AIDS. (cc).

programme.title: W.

Bush in Oliver Stone's surprisingly restrained biopic tracing Bush's transformation from a privileged, partying frat boy to a born-again Christian and conservative politician. Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, James Cromwell, Richard Dreyfuss. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Truth About Charlie
programme.desc: A loose remake of the 1963 film "Charade," this romantic thriller focuses on a mysterious American who aids a Parisian who is menaced by crooks after her husband is killed. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Alamo

programme.title: Anywhere but Here
programme.desc: A flighty mother and her grounded daughter clash over the direction of their lives after leaving their drab Midwestern town for a more glamorous life in L.A. In time, a family tragedy forces both of them to grow up. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Starring Adam West
programme.desc: Actor Adam West is profiled. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Cop Car
programme.desc: Two rebellious young boys steal a police cruiser and go for a joyride. But when they find a dead body in the trunk, they realize they must evade the car's owner, a corrupt small-town sheriff who's desperate to reclaim his property. (cc).(n)

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy
programme.desc: Woody Allen's turn-of-the-century romp involving couples during a weekend in the country. Mia Farrow, Jose Ferrer, Julie Hagerty. Maxwell: Tony Roberts. Adrian: Mary Steenburgen. Gordon Willis photography. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Big Fish
programme.desc: A chronicle of the life of Edward Bloom, a garrulous Southerner whose tall tales have always alienated his no-nonsense son, Will. But with Edward near death, Will must come to terms with his father and his stories before it's too late. (cc).(n)

programme.title: 500 Days of Summer
programme.desc: Greeting-card copywriter Tom falls head over heels for his coworker Summer in this romantic comedy. Tom thinks that he's finally found his soul mate, but Summer claims not to believe in true love and is only interested in having some fun with Tom. The film moves forward and backward through various incidents in Tom and Summer's 500-day love affair. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Royal Tenenbaums
programme.desc: A clan's estranged patriarch loses his home and learns that his ex-wife plans to remarry, so he pretends to be dying to win back his family. Although his ex lets him move back in, his three adult children don't react well to their father's return. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: Forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: Action flick about an emergency chief and a geologist who scramble to halt the destruction of L.A. from a volcanic eruption. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians The Lightning Thief
programme.desc: Accident-prone teenager Percy discovers he's actually a demigod, the son of Poseidon, and he must master his newfound skills and find Zeus' stolen lightning in order to prevent a war between the Greek gods that could devastate the entire world. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman deals with the pain of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A team of gay men dispenses advice on fashion, food, wine and culture to straight counterparts who have trouble impressing the ladies.

programme.sub-title: A Great Mess in Great Neck: Adam Zalta

programme.sub-title: Hair Today, Art Tomorrow: Brian `Butch' Schepel

programme.desc: Conclusion: Michael throws Jr. out of the house after he and Jay find their son in their bed with his girlfriend (Meagan Good). Jay disagrees---strenuously---about the punishment, and the Kyle household is not a happy one. As for Jr., he has been banished to a tent in the backyard. Franklin: Noah Gray-Cabey. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael and Jay are both called for jury duty and wind up on the same case. It's “open and shut,” Michael declares. Jay demurs, not surprisingly. And she suspects Michael's motives because she knows he wants to get home to watch a “Godfather” marathon on TV. Thug: Steve Schirripa. Blue-Collar Guy: Brent Sexton. Judge: Thom Gossom Jr. Prosecutor: Maggie Rowe. R.J.: DeRay Davis. Todd: Allen Todd Lynn. Brian: Brian Holtzman. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire and Jr. have been fighting all their lives, but when both claim to have found a wallet with $500 (and no I.D.) in it, it's time for “family court,” the honorable (“and very handsome”) Judge Michael Kyle presiding. Jay agrees to serve as Claire's lawyer while Kady's genius boyfriend Franklin (Noah Gray-Cabey) argues for Jr. Meanwhile, Claire decides to become a vegetarian, prompted by her boyfriend, Tony (Andrew McFarlane), who has begun to fast. And Michael volunteers to teach Kady to ride a bicycle. Vanessa: Meagan Good. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Hollywood
programme.desc: A1 confronts Lyrica about Kimberly's allegations. A raging family feud threatens Ray J. and Princess' gender reveal party. Marcus blindsides Brooke with an unwelcoming surprise. Kimberly comes face-to-face with a ghost from her past. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: OG and her man discover they're not seeing eye to eye on marriage. Malaysia tries to keep her family from tearing itself apart. An explosive rumor threatens to destroy a friendship within the group. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Shaunie launches an investigation into a rumor that could blow up the group, and it results in more questions than answers. Jen continues to cover up her part. Meanwhile, Malaysia is pleasantly surprised when Cece and Byron set her up on a blind date with their handsome friend. At a meeting of the Wives, Tami lashes out and says something she can't take back. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Tami lashes out at Evelyn, leaving the entire group taking cover and taking sides. As an escape, Evelyn puts together a charity event, but Shaunie refuses to welcome Jen. Malaysia tries to get CeCe and Kristen past their conflict. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie stars in a play, but her nerves threaten to get the best of her. OG deals with the death of her brother, the loss ultimately brings her and an enemy close. The Wives come out to support Jackie's play, but there's just as much drama off-stage. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Evelyn's trip to Puerto Rico becomes a more emotional experience than she bargained for. Jen enlists professional help to solve her love life issues. Malaysia has a difficult talk with her son. Jackie helps Reggie plan next step. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: A social satire in which two inept black FBI agents pose as spoiled white socialites to uncover a kidnapping plot.(n)

programme.desc: Welcome to the weekend! Here on Viva it's Happy Hour & that means that you'll get 2 tracks from each of your fave stars! So grab a drink, make a dancefloor in your lounge and enjoy our 2-4-1 special!

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. programme.title: Jazdy Gwiazdy
programme.desc: Gospodarz programu Filip "Rudy" Rudanacja zaprasza do swojego garbusa znane i lubiane gwiazdy show-biznesu. Podczas wspólnej przejażdżki nie zawaha się zapytać swojego gościa o wszystko, na co ma ochotę i co chcieliby usłyszeć widzowie.

programme.title: Będę grał w grę
programme.desc: Magazyn skierowany do miłośników gier komputerowych. Jego autorzy omawiają i testują najnowsze propozycje, które trafiają na rynek.

programme.desc: Program o nowinkach technicznych. Autorzy przedstawiają najnowsze gadżety, smartfony itp.

programme.title: Polska noc
programme.desc: Dla tych, którzy twierdzą, że w telewizjach muzycznych i radiach pojawia się za mało polskiej muzyki, Eska TV proponuje program "Polska noc". To całonocne pasmo zarezerwowane jest dla krajowych wykonawców.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: Traditionally Martha and Jas have had a joint birthday party, with their birthdays falling close together. Martha and Mrs Fitzgerald have up until now led the way in terms of the choice of party theme - characteristically formal, complete with lobster and butler - and not much fun. When Jas and her dad suggest `shaking it up' a bit this year and introducing a Mexican theme, it leads first of all to the parents falling out and then to Martha and Jas themselves. It's the battle of the lobster vs the Mexican donkey pinata called Percy.

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: The class learns about the Women's Movement and feminism, and the girls put what their lessons into action as they protest against needless airbrushing of year-book photos.

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: Jas decides to follow in her dad's footsteps and try out for the junior hockey team. Mr Salford was a legendary hockey goalie in his time at the school. When the try-outs are cancelled due to the coach not being available, Mr Salford steps in and offers his services as coach. Mrs Griggs is horrified - she could do without the chaos he inevitably brings with him - but he won't take no for an answer. Jas and her father are really superstitious and when things start going wrong Jas thinks she's jinxed, and then that she's passed on the jinx to her dad. When she's not picked as goalie for the team Jas is actually relieved - it must mean she's still jinxed and hasn't passed on the jinx to her dad. Eventually Jas does need to play in goal, but when she saves a crucial penalty she and her dad are delighted to realise they are not jinxed after all, just accident-prone! Meanwhile, Martha & Ollie get paranoid that Cassie & Maxwell are usurping them. They've taken over their favourite nook in the library and when they turn up to do their regular security check on Mrs Rennison's computer Cassie and Maxwell have already been there and done it. They decide they've got to get their own back and they sabotage a fizzy drinks maker Cassie and Maxwell have created to provide refreshments at the hockey match. They turn up the CO2 dial and everyone gets very burpy! Lily is feeling abandoned by her friends - they all seem too busy to hang out with her. Matt advises her that a big gesture could do the trick. When she unfurls a giant banner during the hockey match declaring her admiration for her friends it's really embarrassing. It does prompt Martha and Ollie to do the right thing, though, and confess to Cassie and Maxwell that they sabotaged their fizzy drinks machine and does inspire Jas to save that crucial penalty.

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: Mrs Griggs decides that a 'social skills' class could be beneficial for certain pupils - including Martha, Rufus, Cassie and Maxwell. When Mrs Griggs tells Martha a winning personality as well as academic achievement is vital in order to get into a top university, Martha panics and is determined to succeed in the social skills class and prove she does indeed have a winning personality. Mrs Griggs volunteers a reluctant Mr Malone to take the classes and hands him a book written by her beloved 'Guru Holeman' called Being Whole as a manual to help him. When Lily is mistakenly led to believe by Jas that Matt is emigrating to Australia she is distraught that he hasn't even told her he's leaving. She becomes convinced it's because she's too easy-going that he hasn't even bothered to tell her. She begs Mrs Griggs to let her go to social skills class, too, so she can learn to be less easy-going. Ollie is then sent there for being too pompous and Jas for being too exuberant. Worn down, eventually Mr Malone has had enough of teaching the class Mrs Griggs' way. He throws the book in the bin and gives the pupils a new exercise of his own - wearing blindfolds so they can feel free without worrying how people see them. It works - a blindfolded Lily is able to tell Matt she'll really miss him when he emigrates, which prompts Matt to tell her that he's not going anywhere. And Martha realises she's doing just fine with the personality she already has.
